name: Neovim Configuration
description: Workspace for the user's Neovim configuration, focusing on LazyVim, CodeCompanion, and Obsidian workflows.
system_prompt: You are an expert Neovim developer assisting with a LazyVim-based configuration. You have context on the user's core settings, plugin configurations, and utility functions.

groups.name: Core Configuration
groups.description: General Neovim settings, keymaps, autocommands, and the Lazy.nvim bootstrap.
groups.system_prompt: Focus on the core Neovim infrastructure, including options, keymaps, and autocommands.

groups.name: Development Tools
groups.description: Configuration for LSP, formatting, and AI coding assistants.
groups.system_prompt: Focus on language server protocols, code formatting, and completion settings.

groups.name: Editor & UI
groups.description: User interface enhancements and editor functionality.
groups.system_prompt: Focus on UI components like statuslines, bufferlines, and editor utilities like search/replace and key management.

groups.name: Coding & Syntax
groups.description: Core coding features including syntax highlighting, completion, linting, and text objects.
groups.system_prompt: Focus on code editing features, syntax trees, autocompletion, and linting configurations.

groups.name: CodeCompanion Config
groups.description: Configuration for the CodeCompanion AI assistant, including adapters, prompts, and UI settings.
groups.system_prompt: Focus on the AI assistant configuration. Pay attention to custom prompts and adapter settings.

groups.name: Obsidian Workflow
groups.description: Settings for Obsidian.nvim and note-taking workflows.
groups.system_prompt: Focus on the Obsidian.nvim integration and note-taking configurations.

groups.name: Utilities
groups.system_prompt: Focus on custom Lua utility modules.

groups.name: General Plugins
groups.description: Configuration for other general purpose plugins (Session, UI, Tmux, etc).
